doc.field: Hydrologically Corrected 10 Meter Digital Elevation Model
Hydrologically Corrected 10 Meter Digital Elevation Model

This dataset is a hydrologically correct 10 meter digital elevation model of the seven county Twin Cities metropolitan area. ''Hydrologically Corrected'' means that the DEM was adjusted to accurately depict surface water drainage, even when the drainage is in underground storm sewers, etc. In some places this DEM will be very different than a normal height-of-land DEM.

''Hydrologically Corrected'' means that the DEM was adjusted to accurately depict surface water drainage, even when the drainage is in underground storm sewers, etc. In some places this DEM will be very different than a normal height-of-land DEM.</abstract> <purpose>To develop a digital elevation model that accurately reflects surface water drainage in the Twin Cities metropolitan area.</purpose> <supplinf>Includes 89 USGS 7.5 minute quadrangles intersecting the minor watersheds intersecting the Twin Cities 7 County Metropolitan Area. This includes the counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington.</supplinf> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <sngdate> <caldate>1980</caldate> </sngdate> </timeinfo> <current>Base information is as current as the publication of its source USGS quadrangle maps which vary in publication date from 1979 to 1990, and the DNR lakes and stream database, assembled from various sources (MNDOT base map, DLG, DRQ and WMO subsurface drainage data).</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete</progress> <update>None planned</update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <native>ArcInfo Version 8x Grid</native> <crossref> <citeinfo> <title>10-foot elevation contours, Metro Streams Network</title> </citeinfo> </crossref> </idinfo> <dataqual> <attracc> <attraccr>This dataset is a grid file with elevation as the only attribute. The accuracy of this attribute is discussed under the topic of vertical position accuracy in this metadata file.</attraccr> </attracc> <logic>The data are topologically correct and verified</logic> <complete>The dataset is complete for the 89 USGS 7.5 minute quadrangles.</complete> <posacc> <horizpa> <horizpar>Positional accuracy for areas derived from 7.5 minute quads cannot be assumed to exceed National Map Accuracy Standards for 1:24,000 scale maps (+/- 40 feet).</horizpar> </horizpa> <vertacc> <vertaccr>Vertical accuracy for areas derived from 7.5 minute quads cannot be assumed to exceed National Map Accuracy Standards for 1:24,000 scale maps with 10-foot elevation contours (+/- 5 feet).</vertaccr> </vertacc> </posacc> <lineage> <srcinfo> <srcscale>24000</srcscale> </srcinfo> <procstep> <procdesc>TOPOGRID processing was performed on digital elevation contours to derive the hydrologically correct elevation model MCDEM. DLG derived contours, depression points, lakes, and streams were used as input for the process.
Datatype contour (UPLNDLN, item elev1) Tolerances used: 5, Horizontal error 1, Vertical error 1 Margin 1 Enforce on Sink TGSINK Lake TGLAKE Stream TGSTRM
Lake surface elevations were calculated as zonal minimums of surface elevations for each lake. The resulting output is in a floating point grid, with units of feet. One DEM (USGS quad 3725) was generated with point elevation data from a level 1 DEM with 30-m cells. Contours and sink inputs were absent for this quad.
The following layers were used in or resulted from the processing: TGSTRM, streams input for processing, TGSINK, depression elevation points used as input, no sink depth value defined, TGLAKE, lakes input, UPLNDLN, elevation contours LK_MASK, lake surface elevations MCDEM_CM, integer elevation values in centimeters MCDEM_FT, integer elevation values in feet Regional DEM MCDEM_FT was divided into 9 watershed DEMs: MCDEM1 - Mississippi River, St. Cloud Watershed (Clearwater and Elk River) MCDEM2 - Crow River Watershed MCDEM3 - South Fork Crow River Watershed MCDEM4 - Rum River Watershed MCDEM5 - Mississippi River, Twin Cities Watershed MCDEM6 - Lower Minnesota River Watershed MCDEM7 - Lower St. Croix River Watershed MCDEM8 - Rush-Vermillion River Watershed MCDEM9 - Cannon River Watershed</procdesc> </procstep> </lineage> </dataqual> <spdoinfo> <indspref>None</indspref> <direct>Raster</direct> <mgmg3obj>Integer grid, 10 meter cell size</mgmg3obj> <mgmg3til>One layer for entire area.</mgmg3til> </spdoinfo> <spref> <horizsys> <geograph> <latres /> <longres /> <geogunit /></geograph> <planar> <mapproj> <mapprojn /> <mgmg4par /> <otherprj /> </mapproj> <gridsys> <gridsysn>UTM</gridsysn> <utm> <utmzone>15</utmzone> </utm> <spcs> <spcszone /> </spcs> <mgmg4coz /> <mgmg4adj /> </gridsys> <planci> <coordrep> <absres>10</absres> <ordres>10</ordres> </coordrep> <distbrep> <distres>10</distres> </distbrep> <plandu>Meters</plandu> </planci> </planar> <geodetic> <horizdn>NAD83</horizdn> <ellips>GRS80</ellips> </geodetic> </horizsys> <vertdef> <altsys> <altdatum>NAVD88</altdatum> <altunits>Feet</altunits> </altsys> <depthsys> <depthdn>Not applicable</depthdn> <depthdu /> </depthsys> </vertdef> </spref> <eainfo> <overview> <eaover>Attributes retain the elevation of the grid cell as derivedfrom the topogrid processing, described in Lineage.
No value attribute table was created.</eaover> <eadetcit>None</eadetcit> </overview> </eainfo> <distinfo> <distrib> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>Mark Kotz</cntper> <cntorg>Metropolitan Council</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos>GIS Database Administrator</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype> mailing and physical address </addrtype> <address>390 Robert Street North</address> <city>St. Paul</city> <state>Minnesota</state> <postal>55101-1805</postal> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>651-602-1644</cntvoice> <cntfax>651-602-1674</cntfax> <cntemail>mark.kotz@metc.state.mn.us</cntemail> </cntinfo> </distrib> <resdesc>DEM10MHYDROCORRECTED</resdesc> <distliab>NOTICE: The Geographic Information System (GIS) Data to which this notice is attached are made available pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act (Minnesota Statutes Chapter 13).
